content: to start the project what I've done is I've taken some cardstock and cut up
into rough stone shapes and layered on top of each other to make stone stairway
elevations so now I've painted that with a flat black spray and I'm gonna hand
paint some colors on so I've got my first rock grey that I'm going to use
and I'm putting on that on fairly wet okay so the other colors will blend into
it let me use some burnt umber and some coffee to add some variation to the
stone now I'm getting a sub black and I'm going to add it around the edges of
the stone and kind of blend it in and that give me a nice look of elevated
stone so it's a nice looking stairway up without actually going up so now I am
going to add some light gray and I'm going to use my wet sponge damp sponge
and I'll just go around the edge to start and then we give it a nice kind of
rough stone texture and just do the rest and we get a really nice effect there
and that would be great in our tavern hey guys here's my Cameron setup with
the flat stairways you say that really simulate going up into a new area now I
had some water coming down and there are little rapid areas and I put the
stairways where the rapids are so it looks like there the water is plunging
down and you can see it really looks like the characters are going up to a
new elevation when they go up these stairs even though it's just a flat
surface with these simulated stairs that's a great way to do that have
elevations in your cavern mmm Roger can't see what's up there guess I better
go up and see mm-hmm well I hear something in the darkness well some wolf
oh it's time for a five year rider again get it on yeah
